item.title:
Heterochromia iridum is a condition in which human or animal eyes have different colors. It can be complete or sectoral, i.e. part of one iris is a different color from its remainder.
[📹 https://t.co/U7N8xvqIKc] https://t.co/cIZDaklNBf

item.title:
Our AI started with games. ♟️ But it didn’t end there. 🌐
Meet MuZero and AlphaZero, two powerful models which have evolved to transform computing itself. They’re already optimising data centres, improving the way we watch videos, and much more.
How? 🧵 https://t.co/NOq3uY3rJm https://t.co/68wEtG0mOO

item.title:
1️⃣ AlphaDev, a specialised version of AlphaZero, discovered faster sorting and hashing algorithms – two processes used to sort, store and retrieve data.
We’ve open sourced these in the LLVM standard C++ and Abseil libraries to help developers globally: https://t.co/NOq3uY3rJm https://t.co/u9X6ijidu8

item.title:
2️⃣ At @Google, a system called Borg helps data centres manage billions of tasks, from delivering search results to processing datasets.
Our AlphaZero model found new ways to better plan these workloads and optimise how hardware is used - meaning more internet for less energy. https://t.co/9xzPRq1PLb

item.title:
3️⃣ We worked with @YouTube to allow our AI system MuZero to help compress videos online.
It was able to reduce the bitrate by 4%, without compromising on visual quality - so you can stream more content even on a slower connection. https://t.co/NOq3uY3rJm https://t.co/lCrgTjDxAS

item.title: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.
item.description: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.
item.content:encoded: DBS is invited to review the protocol to help the replication be as close & informative as possible. DBS could v easily help but strategically declines, so that when the study fails to replicate, DBS can point to various "flaws" in the design as the reason for the failure.

item.title:
DBS might then try to sneak in a face-saving post-hoc commentary to the journal, arguing why the replication was flawed & should be ignored.
Fortunately, science (in my field at least) is becoming better at preventing this tactic by DBS's. Perhaps politics will get there too.

item.title:
Scientists have long questioned whether cell membranes support or resist long-range membrane tension propagation, a driver for many cell processes.
HHMI Investigator Carlos Bustamante & collaborators at Berkeley & UCSF believe they’ve settled the debate. https://t.co/MpmBr5LDD7
